lethal: When a creature is reduced to 0 @L[Core:Hit Points and Mana Points]{MP} or below due to lethal drain, it is instead reduced to half their maximum @L[Core:Hit Points and Mana Points]{MP} below zero @L[Core:Hit Points and Mana Points]{MP}. If this is not possible, their @L[Core:Hit Points and Mana Points]{MP} reduces to the lowest value it can go to. This counts as a @L[Category:Killing effects]{killing effect}.
mana: Mana drain is similar to @L[Core:Damage]{damage}, but it reduces @L[Core:MP]{MP} instead of @L[Core:HP]{HP}.
memory: Memory drain is identical to @L[Drain:Mana]{mana drain}, but it is not blocked by @L[Property:Silver]{silver}. If you are @L[Condition:Down]{dropped} with Memory Drain then you forget the hour before you went @L[Condition:Down]{down}. If you are @L[Condition:Dead]{killed} by memory drain, you automatically forget all the events of the day prior to your @L[Condition:Dead]{death}. You pull from the @L[Keyword:Death Bag]{death bag} as though you always have one additional black stone. Pulling one black stone will give you a @L[Keyword:Death Bag]{death scar} and two will make you @L[Keyword:Death Bag]{PD}. You always gain a permanent insanity from memory drain deaths determined by the @L[Core:Game Master]{GM}.
morganti: Morganti drain cannot be @L[Core:Healing]{healed}. This includes @L[Condition:Dead]{death} and @L[Condition:Unconscious]{unconsciousness} imposed by it. If a creature is @L[Condition:Dead]{killed} with morganti damage then they cannot be @L[Category:Revival effects]{revived}.
wither: If a creature takes Wither, then they age a number of years equal to the amount of Wither that they took. This aging is relative to a 100 year lifespan, regardless of how long the creature's lifespan would naturally be.
